item.title: Ticket #217 (Not stripping whitespace from directory path) created
item.dc:creator: monachus
item.description: In Options, under Miscellaneous, if the entry for Destination Directory has a space after it, going to the Upload screen will generate an error that permissions are incorrect and uploads won't work. Just looks like you aren't stripping whitespace from the field before using it.

Errorlog says it all...

[Sun Aug 8 00:45:41 2004] [error] PHP Fatal error: Call to undefined function add_magic_quotes() in /home/wordpress/wp-admin/user-edit.php on line 23

item.title: Ticket #113 (Post content 'lost' if multiple <!--more--> (more...) tags used.) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
Simple fix for this:

in wp-includes/template-functions-post.php, function get_the_content().

Change this:

$content = explode('<!--more-->', $content);

to:

$content = explode('<!--more-->', $content, 2);

I've attached a diff. Also discussed the change <a href="​http://www.coffee2code.com/archives/2004/08/03/patch-dealing-with-multiple-more/">here</a>.

item.title: Ticket #215 (Generic Lists) created
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description: The "Links" feature of WordPress is very useful. Along the same lines, it may also be a good idea to allow generic lists for authors to post, for example, books he/she is currently reading, or CDs being currently being listened to.

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: Brak
item.description:
Confirmed.

However, it's on the PHP end, not the the Wordpress end.

I first upgraded to Wordpress current (4th august) and it still segfaulted. Then I upgraded to PHP 5.0.x-dev (6th august) and it's now working.
